article_text:
Back in the old era of American politics—say the election of 2008—the highest goal of Republicans or Democrats was to win the presidency and to control both houses of Congress. With what the ancients then called “control of government,” the victorious party would enact legislation reflecting its beliefs and ideas.

After the 2008 elections gave Democrats control of the executive and legislative branches, they passed the Affordable Care Act and the Dodd-Frank financial reform act, which together reordered great swaths of...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Wonder Land columnist Daniel Henninger writes that the GOP may be throwing away a chance at victory in 2016.
twitter.creator: @danhenninger
twitter.title: Republicans on the Brink

article_summary:
Back in the old era of American politics—say the election of 2008—the highest goal of Republicans or Democrats was to win the presidency and to control both houses of Congress.
After the 2008 elections gave Democrats control of the executive and legislative branches, they passed the Affordable Care Act and the Dodd-Frank financial reform act, which together reordered great swaths of...
With what the ancients then called “control of government,” the victorious party would enact legislation reflecting its beliefs and ideas.
